intro: Onagra lehmanniana, commonly known as the Mexican flax or wild flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in arid and semi-arid regions. Onagra lehmanniana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
